flavor:
"I am Aragorn son of Arathorn; and if by life or death I can save you, I will."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Aragorn
text: Sentinel. Response: After Aragorn commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from his resource pool to ready him.

flavor:
"Not all is dark. Take courage, Lord of the Mark..."
<cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Théodred
text: Response: After Théodred commits to a quest, choose a hero committed to that quest. Add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

flavor:
His beard, very long and forked, was white, nearly as white as the snow-white cloth of his garments.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Glóin
text: Response: After Glóin suffers damage, add 1 resource to his resource pool for each point of damage he just suffered.

flavor: "Men need many words before deeds. My axe is restless in my hands." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Gimli
text: Gimli gets +1 [attack] for each damage token on him.

flavor:
"I can walk this path, but others have not this skill."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Legolas
text: Ranged. Response: After Legolas participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, place 2 progress tokens on the current quest.

name: Thalin
text: While Thalin is committed to a quest, deal 1 damage to each enemy as it is revealed by the encounter deck.

flavor:
Slender and tall she was in her white robe girt with silver; but strong she seemed and stern as steel, a daughter of kings.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Éowyn
text: Action: Discard 1 card from your hand to give Éowyn +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase. This effect may be triggered by each player once each round.

flavor:
"Gondor wanes, you say. But Gondor stands, and even the end of its strength is very strong."
<cite>Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Eleanor
text: Response: Exhaust Eleanor to cancel the "when revealed" effects of a treachery card just revealed by the encounter deck. Then, discard that card, and replace it with the next card from the encounter deck.

flavor:
Captains rode to meet him at the ford, bearing messages from Gandalf. Dúnhere, chieftain of the folk of Harrowdale, was at their head.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Dúnhere
text: Dúnhere can target enemies in the staging area when he attacks alone. When doing so, he gets +1 [attack].

flavor:
"And the lord Denethor is unlike other men: he sees far."
<cite>Beregond, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Denethor
text: Action: Exhaust Denethor to look at the top card of the encounter deck. You may move that card to the bottom of the deck.

flavor:
"You saw him for a moment as he is upon the other side: one of the mighty of the firstborn."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Glorfindel
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from Glorfindel's pool to heal 1 damage on any character. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
But in the wild lands beyond Bree there were mysterious wanderers. The Bree-folk called them Rangers, and knew nothing of their origin.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Beravor
text: Action: Exhaust Beravor to choose a player. That player draws 2 cards. Limit once per round.

flavor:
"But the Lords of Minas Tirith still fight on, defying our enemies, keeping the passage of the River from Argonath to the Sea."
<cite>Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Guard of the Citadel

flavor:
"He leads now in all perilous ventures. But his life is charmed, or fate spares him for some other end."
<cite>Mablung, Ranger of Ithilien,
The Two Towers</cite>
name: Faramir
text: Action: Exhaust Faramir to choose a player. Each character controlled by that player gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

flavor:
...and the North-realm they made in Arnor, and the South-realm in Gondor above the mouths of Anduin.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Son of Arnor
text: Response: After Son of Arnor enters play, choose an enemy card in the staging area or currently engaged with another player. Engage that enemy.

flavor:
...he saw not a shadow, nor a blur, but the small figures of horsemen, many horsemen, and the glint of morning on the tips of their spears was like the twinkle of minute stars beyond the edge of mortal sight.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Snowbourn Scout
text: Response: After Snowbourn Scout enters play, choose a location. Place 1 progress token on that location.

flavor:
"We have been keeping watch on the rivers, ever since we saw a great troop of Orcs going north towards Moria, along the skirts of the mountains, many days ago."
<cite>Haldir of Lórien, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Silverlode Archer
text: Ranged.

flavor:
Five dead Orcs lay there. They had been hewn with many cruel strokes, and two had been beheaded. The ground was wet with their dark blood.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Longbeard Orc Slayer
text: Response: After Longbeard Orc Slayer enters play, deal 1 damage to each Orc enemy in play.

flavor:
...there is no knowing what a Dwarf will not dare and do for revenge and the recovery of his own.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Brok Ironfist
text: Response: After a Dwarf hero you control leaves play, put Brok Ironfist into play from your hand.

flavor:
"...no road looks toward safety any longer. Be vigilant!"
<cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Ever Vigilant
text: Action: Choose and ready 1 ally card.

flavor:
"We will make such a chase as shall be accounted a marvel among the Three Kindreds: Elves, Dwarves, and Men."
<cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Common Cause
text: Action: Exhaust 1 hero you control to choose and ready a different hero.

flavor:
And the tree that was withered shall be renewed,
and he shall plant it in high places,
and the City shall be blessed.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: For Gondor!
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, all characters get +1 [attack]. All Gondor characters also get +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.

flavor:
There is a seed of courage hidden (often deeply, it is true) in the heart of the fattest and most timid hobbit, waiting for some final and desperate danger to make it grow.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Sneak Attack
text: Action: Put 1 ally card into play from your hand. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, return it to your hand.

flavor:
"He fell defending the Hobbits, while I was away upon the hill.
<cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Valiant Sacrifice
text: Response: After an ally card leaves play, that card's controller draws 2 cards.

flavor: "If there is only one way, then I must take it. What comes after must come." <cite>Frodo Baggins, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Grim Resolve
text: Action: Ready all character cards in play.

flavor:
"It was commanded yesterday."
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Steward of Gondor
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the Gondor trait. Action: Exhaust Steward of Gondor to add 2 resources to attached hero's resource pool.

flavor:
"You needn't," said Bilbo. "As a matter of fact it was all mine. Except that Aragorn insisted on my putting in a green stone. He seemed to think it important. I don't know why."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Celebrían's Stone
text:
Attach to a hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gains +2 [willpower]
If attached hero is Aragorn, he also gains a [spirit] resource icon.

flavor: "I am glad to have you standing nigh with your stout legs and your hard axe." <cite>Legolas, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Veteran Axehand

flavor: More than a thousand were there mustered. Their spears were like a sprining wood. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Gondorian Spearman
text: Sentinel. Response: After Gondorian Spearman is declared as a defender, deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

flavor: A few of the riders appeared to be bowmen, skilled at shooting from a running horse. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Horseback Archer
text: Ranged.

flavor: "I don't need your service, thank you...but I expect you need mine." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Beorn
text: Action: Beorn gains +5 [attack] until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase in which you trigger this effect, shuffle Beorn back into your deck. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
Throwing back his cloak, he laid his hand on the hilt of a sword that had hung concealed by his side. They did not dare to move.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Blade Mastery
text: Action: Choose a character. Until the end of the phase, that character gains +1 [attack] and +1 [defense].

flavor: Arrows thick as the rain came whistling over the battlements, and fell clinking and glancing on th estones. Many found their mark. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Rain of Arrows
text: Action: Exhaust a character you control with the ranged keyword to choose a player. Deal 1 damage to each enemy engaged with that player.

flavor: A few brave men were strung before them to make a feint of resistance, and many there fell before the rest drew back and fled to either side. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Feint
text: Combat Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.

flavor: "...for he that strikes the first blow, if he strikes it hard enough, may need to strike no more." <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Quick Strike
text: Action: Exhaust a character you control to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against any eligible enemy target.

flavor:
With a word or cry, suddenly, the Riders halted. A thicket of spears were pointed towards the strangers...
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Thicket of Spears
text: You must use resources from 3 different heroes' pools to pay for this card. Action: Choose a player. That player's engaged enemies cannot attack that player this phase.

flavor:
A swift stroke she dealt, skilled and deadly.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Swift Strike
text: Response: After a character is declared as a defender, deal 2 damage to the attacking enemy.

flavor: ...and when the task was done, there they would come to an end, alone, houseless, foodless in the midst of a terrible desert. There could be no return. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Stand Together
text: Action: Choose a player. That player may declare any number of his eligible characters as defenders against each enemy attacking him this phase.

flavor:
It was rather splendid to be wearing a blade made in Gondolin for the goblin-wars of which so many songs had sung...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Blade of Gondolin
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] when attacking an Orc. Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, place 1 progress token on the current quest.

flavor:
"Go to the armouries of the Citadel, and get you there the livery and gear of the Tower."
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Citadel Plate
text:
Attach to a hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gets +4 Hit Points.

flavor:
"But keep your bow ready to hand, and I will keep my axe loose in my belt."
<cite>Gimli, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Dwarven Axe
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gains +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attached hero is a Dwarf.)

flavor:
'Slow should you be to wind that horn again, Boromir,' said Elrond, 'until you stand once more on the borders of your land, and dire need is on you.'
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Horn of Gondor
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Response: After a character is destroyed, add 1 resource to attached hero's pool.

flavor: ...but certainly there was something not entirely hobbit-like about them, and once in a while members of the Took-clan would go and have adventures. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Wandering Took
text: Action: Reduce your threat by 3 to give control of Wandering Took to another player. Raise that player's threat by 3.

flavor: "Indeed deep in the wood they dwell..." <cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lórien Guide
text: Response: After Lórien Guide commits to a quest, place 1 progress token on the active location.

flavor:
"What roads would any dare to tread, what safety would there be in quiet lands, or in the homes of simple men at night, if the Dúnedain were asleep, or were all gone into the grave?"
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Northern Tracker
text: Response: After Northern Tracker commits to a quest, place 1 progress token on each location in the staging area.

flavor:
"Welcome to Caras Galadhan!" he said. "Here is the city of the Galadhrim where dwell the Lord Celeborn and Galadriel the Lady of Lórien"
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The Galadhrim's Greeting
text: Action: Reduce one player's threat by 6, or reduce each player's threat by 2.

flavor:
Then Aragorn lead the way, and such was the strength of his will in that hour that all the Dúnedain and their horses followed him.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Strength of Will
text: Response: After you travel to a location, exhaust a [spirit] character to place 2 progress tokens on that location.

flavor:
'The hasy stroke goes oft astray,' said Aragorn. 'We must press our Enemy, and no longer wait on him for the next move.'
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Hasty Stroke
text: Response: Cancel a shadow effect just triggered during combat.

flavor:
"If Gondor has such men still in these days of fading, great must have been its glory in the days of its rising."
<cite>Legolas, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Will of the West
text: Action: Choose a player. Shuffle that player's discard pile back into his deck. Remove Will of the West from the game.

flavor:
"There is naught that you can do, other than to resist, with hope or without it"
<cite>Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: A Test of Will
text: Response: Cancel the "when revealed" effects of a card that was just revealed from the encounter deck.

flavor: "...we will fight on." <cite>Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Stand and Fight
text: Action: Choose an ally with a printed cost of X in any player's discard pile. Put that ally into play under your control. (The chosen ally can belong to any sphere of influence.)

flavor:
The light of the torches and the fire flickered about them...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: A Light in the Dark
text: Action: Choose an enemy engaged with a player. Return that enemy to the staging area.

flavor:
The dwarves no more shall suffer wrong,
The dwarves of your made mighty spells,
While hammers fell like ringing bells
In places deep, where dark things sleep,
In hollow halls beneath the fells.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Dwarven Tomb
text: Action: Return 1 [spirit] card from your discard pile to your hand.

flavor:
'Yes, fortune or fate have heped you,' said Gandalf, 'not to mention courage.'
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Fortune or Fate
text: Action: Choose a hero in any player's discard pile. Put that card into play, under its owner's control.

flavor:
"You are indeed high in the favor of the Lady!"
<cite>Unnamed Elf of Lórien,
The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The Favor of the Lady
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains +1 [willpower].

flavor:
"Power to defy our Enemy is not in him, unless shuch power is in the earth itself."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Power in the Earth
text:
Attach to a location.
Attached location gets -1 [threat].

flavor:
"Here am I, naughty little fly;
you are fat and lazy.
You cannot trap me, though you try,
in your cobwebs crazy."
<cite>Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Unexpected Courage
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust Unexpected Courage to ready attached hero.

flavor: "Here is Nimrodel! Of this stream the Silvan Elves made many songs long ago, and still we sing them in the North...I will bate my feet, for it is said that the water is healing to the weary." <cite>Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Daughter of the Nimrodel
text: Action: Exhaust Daughter of the Nimrodel to heal up to 2 damage on any 1 hero.

flavor: "In Erebor in the Kingdom of Dain there is such skill..." <cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Erebor Hammersmith
text: Response: After you play Erebor Hammersmith, return the topmost attachment in any player's discard pile to his hand.

flavor:
"And I reckon there's Elves and Elves. They're all elvish enough, but they're not all the same."
<cite>Sam Gamgee,
The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Henamarth Riversong
text: Action: Exhaust Henamarth Riversong to look at the top card of the encounter deck.

flavor:
...while the four dwarves sat around the table, and talked about mines and gold and troubles with goblins...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Miner of the Iron Hills
text: Response: After Miner of the Iron Hills enters play, choose and discard 1 Condition attachment from play.

flavor:
Then the Riders of the King's House upon white horses rode round about the barrow and sang together a song of Théoden Thengle's son that Gléowine his minstrel made...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gléowine
text: Action: Exhaust Gléowine to choose a player. That player draws 1 card.

flavor:
"...understanding, making and healing...These things the Elves of Middle-earth have in some measure gained, though with sorrow."
<cite>Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lore of Imladris
text: Action: Choose a character. Heal all damage from that character.

flavor:
"That is the fairest of all the dwellings of my people. There are no trees like the tress of that land."
<cite>Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lórien's Wealth
text: Action: Choose a player. That player draws 3 cards.

flavor: "Radagast is, of course, a worthy Wizard, a master of shapes and changes of hue; and he has much lore of herbs and beasts, and birds are especially his friends." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Radagast's Cunning
text: Quest Action: Choose an enemy in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, that enemy does not contribute its [threat]

flavor: ...Beorn advised them to take this way; for at a place a few days' ride due north of the Carrock was the gate of a little-known pathway through Mirkwood... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Secret Paths
text: Quest Action: Choose a location in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, that location does not contribute its [threat]

flavor:
"Less welcome did the Lord Denethor show me then than of old, and grudgingly he permitted me to search among his hoarded scrolls and books."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Gandalf's Search
text: Action: Look at the top X cards of any player's deck, add 1 of those cards to its owner's hand, and return the rest to the top of the deck in any order.

flavor:
"...and my house is open to you, if ever you come back this way again."
<cite>Beorn, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Beorn's Hospitality
text: Action: Choose a player. Heal all damage on each hero controlled by that player.

flavor:
"We shall have it like a coney in a trap. Then we shall learn what kind of thing it is."
<cite>Unidentified Man of Gondor,
The Two Towers</cite>
name: Forest Snare
text:
Attach to an enemy engaged with a player.
Attached enemy cannot attack.

flavor:
'Speak no evil of the lady Galadriel!' said Aragorn sternly. 'There is in her and in this land no evil, unless a man bring it hither himself. Then let him beware.'
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Protector of Lórien
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Discard a card from your hand to give attached hero +1 [defense] or +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase. Limit 3 times per phase.

flavor:
'Go on then!' said Frodo. 'What do you know?'
'Too much; too many dark things,' said Strider grimly.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Dark Knowledge
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets -1 [willpower] Response: Exhaust Dark Knowledge to look at 1 shadow card that was just dealt to an enemy attacking you.

flavor:
...how much more of this would they have to endure, or could they endure?
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Self Preservation
text: Attach to a character. Action: Exhaust Self Preservation to heal 2 points of damage from attached character.

name: Gandalf
text: At the end of the round, discard Gandalf from play. Response: After Gandalf enters play, (choose 1): draw 3 cards, deal 4 damage to 1 enemy in play, or reduce your threat by 5.

flavor:
"Well, my dear fellow," said Bilbo, "now you've heard the news, can't you spare me a moment? I want your help in something urgent."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Bilbo Baggins
text: The first player draws 1 additional card in the resource phase.

name: Dúnedain Mark
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +1 [attack] Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Mark to another hero.

flavor: "It is a fair tale, though it is sad, as are all the tales of Middle-earth, and yet it may lift up your hearts." <cite>Strider, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Campfire Tales
text: Action: Each player draws 1 card.

name: Winged Guardian
text: Sentinel. Winged Guardian cannot have restricted attachments. Forced: After an attack in which Winged Guardian defends resolves, pay 1 [tactics] resource or discard Winged Guardian from play.

flavor: "The Eagles! The Eagles!" <cite>Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit</cite>
name: The Eagles Are Coming!
text: Action: Search the top 5 cards of your deck for any number of Eagle cards and add them to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

flavor: "Your own valour has done more, and the stout legs of the Westfold-men marching through the night." <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Westfold Horse-Breaker
text: Action: Discard Westfold Westfold Horse-Breaker to choose and ready a hero.

flavor: "More speed we cannot make, if the strength of Rohan is to be gathered." <cite>Éomer, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Mustering the Rohirrim
text: Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for any 1 Rohan card and add it to your hand. Then, shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

flavor: As Elrond entered and went towards the seat prepared for him, Elvish minstrels began to make sweet music. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Rivendell Minstrel
text: Response: After you play Rivendell Minstrel from your hand, search your deck for 1 Song card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

flavor: "My cuts, short or long, don't go wrong." <cite>Strider, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Strider's Path
text: Response: After a location is revealed from the encounter deck, immediately travel to that location without resolving its Travel effect. If another location is currently active, return it to the staging area.

flavor:
From the ashes a fire shall be woken,
A light from the shadows shall spring:
Renewed shall be blade that was broken,
The crownless again shall be king.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Song of Kings
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains a [leadership] resource icon.

flavor: Frodo began to feel restless, and the old paths seemed too well-trodden. he looked at maps and wondered what lay beyond their edges... <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Frodo Baggins
text: Response: After Frodo Baggins is damaged, cancel the damage and instead raise your threat by the amount of damage he would have been dealt. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Dúnedain Warning
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +1 [defense] Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Warning to another hero.

flavor:
...he was just sitting down to a nice little second-breakfast in the dinning-room...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Second Breakfast
text: Action: Each player returns the topmost attachment card from his discard pile to his hand.

flavor: "We are getting near," said Gandalf. "We are on th eedge of his bee pastures." <cite> The Hobbit</cite>
name: Beorning Beekeeper
text: Action: Discard Beorning Beekeeper from play to deal 1 damage to each enemy in the staging area.

flavor: "Very well," said Gandalf. "Take us where and as far as you will!" <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Born Aloft
text: Attach to an ally. Action: Discard Born Aloft from play to return attached ally to its owner's hand.

flavor: "You I have not seen before, for you are young, but I have spoken with Eomund your father..." <cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Éomund
text: Response: After Éomund leaves play, ready all Rohan characters in play.

flavor: "Nor indeed am I a stranger: for I have been in this land before, more than once, and ridden with the host of the Rohirrim, though under other name and in other guise." <cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Nor am I a Stranger
text: Attach to a character. Attached character gains the Rohan trait.

flavor: On the table in the light of a big lamp with a red shade he spread a piece of parchment rather like a map. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Longbeard Map-Maker
text: Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource to give Longbeard Map-Maker +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

flavor:
"Keep close to the fire, with your faces outward!" cried Strider. "Keep some of th elonger sticks ready in your hands."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: A Burning Brand
text:
Attach to a [lore] character.
While attached character is defending, cancel any shadow effects on cards dealt to the attacking enemy.

flavor:
It sit beside the fire and think
of all that I have seen,
of meadow-flowers and butterflies
in summers that have been
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Song of Wisdom
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains a [lore] resource icon.

flavor: But beyond, in the great fief of Belfalas, dwelt Prince Imrahil in his castle of Dol Amroth by the sea, and he was of high blood, and his fold also, tall men and proud with sea-grey eyes. <cite>The Return of the King.</cite>
name: Prince Imrahil
text: Response: After a character leaves play, ready Prince Imrahil. (Limit once per round.)

name: Dúnedain Quest
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +1 [willpower] Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Quest to another hero.

flavor: Inside the hall there was piled a large assortment of packages and parcels and small articles of furniture. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Parting Gifts
text: Action: Move any number of resource tokens from a [leadership] hero's resource pool to any other hero's resource pool.

name: Landroval
text: Sentinel. Landroval cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After a hero card is destroyed, return Landroval to his owner's hand to put that hero back into play, with 1 damage token on it. (Limit once per game.)

flavor: The pale peaks of the mountains were coming nearer, moonlit spikes of rock sticking out of black shadows. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: To the Eyrie
text: Response: After an ally is destroyed, exhaust 1 Eagle character to move that ally from the discard pile to its owner's hand.

name: Escort from Edoras
text: While committed to a quest, Escort from Edoras gets +2 [willpower] Forced: After resolving a quest to which Escort from Edoras was committed, discard Escort from Edoras from play.

flavor: The Mathom-house it was called; for anything that Hobbits had no immediate use for, but were unwilling to throw away, they called a mathom. Their dwellings were apt to become rather crowded with mathoms... <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Ancient Mathom
text: Attach to a location. Response: After attached location is explored, the first player draws 3 cards.

flavor: "But there are some of us still who go abroad for the gathering of news and the watching of our enemies, and they speak the languages of other lands." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Haldir of Lórien
text: Ranged. Sentinel.

flavor: That's cursed rebel-talk, and I'll stick you, if you don't shut it down, see? <cite>Orc Soldier, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Infighting
text: Action: Move any number of damage from one enemy to another.

flavor: "I have an urgent errand. My news is evil."
name: Radagast
text: Radagast collects 1 resource each resource phase. These resources can be used to pay for Creature cards played from your hand. Action: Spend X resources from Radagast's pool to heal X wounds on any 1 Creature.

flavor:
"The grandson of Bard the Bowman rules them, Brand son of Bain son of Bard."
<cite>Glóin, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Brand son of Bain
text: Ranged. Response: After Brand son of Bain attacks and defeats an enemy engaged with another player, choose and ready one of that player's characters.

flavor:
Then something Tookish woke up inside him...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Keen-eyed Took
text: Response: After Keen-eyed Took enters play, reveal the top card of each player's deck. Action: Return Keen-eyed Took to your hand to discard the top card of each player's deck.

flavor:
In the dark at the rear, grim and silent, walked Aragorn.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Rear Guard
text: Quest Action: Discard a [leadership] ally to give each hero committed to this quest +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Descendant of Thorondor
text: Descendant of Thorondor cannot have restricted attachments. Response: After Descendant of Thorondor enters or leaves play, deal 2 damage to any 1 enemy in the staging area.

flavor:
Not event an eagle poised against the sun would have marked the hobbits sitting there, under the weight of doom...
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Meneldor's Flight
text: Action: Choose an Eagle ally. Return that character to its owner's hand.

flavor:
"And there are no horses like the ones that are bred in that great vale between the Misty Mountains and the White."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The Riddermark's Finest
text: Action: Exhaust and discard The Riddermark's Finest to place 2 progress tokens on any location.

flavor:
"Death! Ride, ride to ruin and the world's ending!"
<cite>Éomer, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Ride to Ruin
text: Action: Discard a Rohan ally to choose a location. Place 3 progress tokens on that location.

flavor: "Go not to the Elves for counsel, for they will say both no and yes." <cite>Frodo Baggins, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Gildor Inglorion
text: Action: Exhaust Gildor Inglorion to look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Switch one of those cards with a card from your hand. Then, return the 3 cards to the top of your deck, in any order.

flavor:
"The wide world is all about you: you can fence yourselves in, but you cannot for ever fence it out."
<cite>Gildor, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Gildor's Counsel
text: Play during the Quest phase, before characters are committed to the Quest. Action: Reveal 1 less card from the encounter deck this phase. (To a minimum of 1.)

flavor:
The Road goes ever on and on
Down from the door where it began.
Now far ahead the road has gone,
And I must follow, if I can.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Song of Travel
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains a [spirit] resource icon.

flavor: "...in Gondor we must trust to such weapons as we have." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Boromir
text: Action: Raise your threat by 1 to ready Boromir. (Limit once per phase.) Action: Discard Boromir to deal 2 damage to each enemy engaged with a single player.

flavor: "If simple folk are free from care and fear, simple they will be, and we must be secret to keep them so. That has been the task of my kindred, while the years have lengthened and the grass has grown." <cite>Strider, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Dúnedain Watcher
text: Response: Discard Dúnedain Watcher from play to cancel the shadow effects of a card just triggered.

name: Dúnedain Cache
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains ranged. Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Cache to another hero.

name: Vassal of the Windlord
text: Ranged.Vassal of the Windlord cannot have restricted attachments. Forced: After an attack in which Vassal of the Windlord attacked resolves, discard Vassal of the Windlord from play.

flavor:
Old fat spider spinning in a tree!
Old fat spider can't see me!
Attercop! Attercop!
Won't you stop. Stop your spinning and look for me!
<cite>Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Song of Mocking
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust Song of Mocking to choose another hero. Until the end of the phase, attached hero takes all damage assigned to the chosen hero.

flavor: "Buy my lord sends word that we must set ourselves in readiness: orders may come for a sudden move." <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Elfhelm
text: While Elfhelm is ready, he gains: "Response: After your threat is raised as the result of questing unsuccessfully, or by an encounter or quest card effect, reduce your threat by 1."

flavor: "But we must ride more warily; for war is abroad, and the Rohirrim, the Horse-lords, do not sleep, even if it seems so from afar." <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: We Do Not Sleep
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, Rohan characters do not exhaust to commit to quests.

flavor: "The Wood-elves tracked him first, an easy task for them, for his trail was still fresh then." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Rings</cite>
name: Silvan Tracker
text: Response: After a Silvan character readies during the refresh phase, heal 1 damage from that character.

flavor: 'And I put as fast a hitch over the stump as any one could have done, in the Shire or out of it.' <cite>Sam, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Fast Hitch
text: Attach to a Hobbit character. Action: Exhaust Fast Hitch to ready attached character.

flavor: We go, we go, we go to war, to hew the stone and break the door. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Song of Battle
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains a [tactics] resource icon.

flavor: "You have not heard of Dáin and the dwarves of the Iron Hills?" <cite>Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Dáin Ironfoot
text: While Dáin Ironfoot is ready, Dwarf characters get +1 [attack] and +1 [willpower].

name: Dúnedain Signal
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains sentinel. Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's pool to attach Dúnedain Signal to another hero.

flavor: "Dawn take you all, and be stone to you!" <cite>Gandalf, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Dawn Take You All
text: Play after shadow cards have been dealt, before any attacks have resolved. Combat Action: Each player may choose and discard 1 facedown shadow card from an enemy with which he is engaged.

name: Eagles of the Misty Mountains
text: Eagles of the Misty Mountains cannot have restricted attachments. Eagles of the Misty Mountains gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] for each facedown attachment it has. Response: After another Eagle character leaves play, you may attach that card facedown to Eagles of the Misty Mountains.

flavor: "I would bear you, whither you will, even were you made of stone." <cite>Gwaihir, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Support of the Eagles
text: Attach to a [tactics] hero. Action: Exhaust Support of the Eagles to choose an Eagle ally. Until the end of the phase, attached hero adds that ally's [attack] or [defense] (choose 1) to its own.

flavor:
The dark world was rushing by, and the wind sang loudly in his ears.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: West Road Traveller
text: Response: After you play West Road Traveller from your hand, switch the active location with any other location in the staging area.

flavor: With astonishing speed and skill they checked their steeds, wheeled, and came charging round. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Astonishing Speed
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, all Rohan characters get +2 [willpower]

name: Mirkwood Runner
text:
While Mirkwood Runner is attacking alone, the defending enemy does not count its [defense].
"...let a ploughman plough, but choose an otter for swimming, and for running light over grass and leaf or over snow-an Elf."
–Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring

flavor: 'Where sight fails the earth may bring us rumour,' said Aragorn. 'The land must groan under their hated feet.' <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Rumour from the Earth
text: Action: Look at the top card of the encounter deck. Then, you may pay 1 [lore] resource to return Rumour from the Earth to your hand.

flavor: The wizard's face remained grave and attentive, and only a flicker in his deep eyes showed that he was startled and indeed alarmed. 'It has been called that before,' he said, 'but not by you.' <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Shadow of the Past
text: Action: Move the top card of the encounter discard pile to the top of the encounter deck.

flavor:
It was a dwarf with a blue beard tucked into a golden belt, and very bright eyes under his dark-green hood.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Dwalin
text: Response: After Dwalin attacks and destroys an Orc enemy, lower your threat by 2.

flavor: "And winter comes after autumn." <cite>Bifur, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Bifur
text: Action: Pay 1 resource from a hero's resource pool to add 1 resource to Bifur's resource pool. Any player may trigger this ability. (Limit once per round.)

name: Narvi's Belt
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Action: Exhaust Narvi's Belt to give attached hero a [leadership], [lore], [tactics] or [spirit] icon until the end of the phase.

flavor:
A king he was on carven throne
In many-pillared halls of stone
With golden roof and silver floor,
And runes of power upon the door.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Durin's Song
text: Action: Choose a Dwarf hero. That hero gets +2 [willpower], +2 [attack], and +2 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: Ever Onward
text: Response: After players quest unsuccessfully, choose a player. That player does not raise his threat.

flavor: With cries of "Moria!" and "Dain, Dain!" the dwarves of the Iron Hills plunged in... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Veteran of Nanduhirion
text: Veteran of Nanduhirion enters play with 1 damage on it.

flavor: "We make good armour and keen swords, but we cannot again make mail or blade to match those that were made before the dragon came." <cite>Gloin, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Dwarrowdelf Axe
text: Restricted. Attach to a Dwarf character. Attached character gets +1 [attack] Response: After attached character attacks, deal 1 damage to the defending enemy.

name: Khazâd! Khazâd!
text: Action: Choose a Dwarf character. Until the end of the phase, that character gets +3 [attack].

name: Zigil Miner
text: Action: Exhaust Zigil Miner and name a number to discard the top 2 cards of your deck. If at least one of those cards has cost equal to the named number, choose a hero you control. For each card that matches the named number, add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

name: Untroubled by Darkness
text: Action: Each Dwarf character gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase. (+2 [willpower] instead if the active location is an Underground or Dark location.)

name: Erebor Record Keeper
text: Erebor Record Keeper cannot attack or defend. Action: Exhaust Erebor Record Keeper and pay 1 [lore] resource to choose and ready a Dwarf character.

name: Ancestral Knowledge
text: Action: Exhaust a Dwarf character to place 2 progress tokens on the active location. (4 progress tokens instead if it is an Underground or Mountain location.)

name: Boots from Erebor
text: Attach to a Dwarf or Hobbit character. Limit 1 Boots from Erebor per character. Attached character gets +1 hit point.

flavor:
"We will not turn back."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Elrohir
text: While Elladan is in play, Elrohir gets +2 [defense]. Response: After Elrohir is declared as a defender, pay 1 resource from his resource pool to ready him.

name: Taking Initiative
text: Action: Discard the top card of your deck. If the discarded card's printed cost is equal to or higher than the number of characters you control, draw 2 cards and deal 2 damage to any enemy.

name: Timely Aid
text: Secrecy 3. Action: Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck and put 1 revealed ally into play, if able. Shuffle all other revealed cards back into your deck.

name: Unseen Strike
text: Action: Choose a character you control. Until the end of the phase, that character gets +3 [attack] while attacking an enemy with a higher engagement cost than your threat.

name: Keeping Count
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gets +1 [attack] for each resource token on another copy of Keeping Count that is above the current number of resource tokens on this card. Forced: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, place 1 resource token on this card.

flavor: "Get up lazy-bones..." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Bofur
text: Quest Action: Spend 1 [spirit] resource to put Bofur into play from your hand, exhausted and committed to a quest. If you quest successfully this phase and Bofur is still in play, return him to your hand.

name: Renewed Friendship
text: Response: After another player plays an attachment on a hero you control, you may (choose 1): ready 1 of that player's heroes, have that player draw 1 card, or lower that player's threat by 2.

flavor: "They made their first camp on the western side of the great southern spur, which ended in a height called Ravenhill." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Ravenhill Scout
text: Action: Exhaust Ravenhill Scout to move up to 2 progress tokens from 1 location to another location.

name: Needful to Know
text: Secrecy 2. Action: Raise your threat by 1 to look at the top card of the encounter deck. Then, reduce your threat by X, where X is the threat of that card.

name: Good Meal
text: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Action: Discard Good Meal to lower the cost of the next event you play this round that matches attached hero's sphere by 2.

flavor:
"Yes, the Dead ride behind."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Elladan
text: While Elrohir is in play, Elladan gets +2 [attack]. Response: After Elladan is declared as an attacker, pay 1 resource from his resource pool to ready him.

flavor:
They roamed at will southwards, and eastwards even as far as the Misty Mountains; but they were no few and rarely seen.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Dúnedain Wanderer
text: Ranged. Sentinel. Secrecy 3.

flavor:
'The road that I speak of leads to the Mines of Moria,' said Gandalf. Only Gimli lifted up his head; a smouldering fire was in his eyes.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lure of Moria
text: Action: Ready all Dwarf characters.

name: Rivendell Blade
text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan character. Restricted. When attached character attacks an enemy, that enemy gets -2 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Hail of Stones
text: Action: Exhaust X characters to deal X damage to an enemy in the staging area.

name: Rider of the Mark
text: Action: Spend 1 [spirit] resource to give control of Rider of the Mark to another player. (Limit once per round.) Response: After Rider of the Mark changes control, discard a shadow card dealt to an enemy you are engaged with.

name: Song of Eärendil
text: Attach to a [spirit] hero. Response: After Song of Eärendil enters play, draw 1 card. Response: After another player raises his threat, raise your threat by 1 to reduce that player's threat by 1.

name: Bombur
text: Action: Exhaust Bombur to choose a location. That location gets -1 [threat] until the end of the phase. (That location does not contribute its [threat] instead if it is an Underground location.)

name: Out of the Wild
text: Secrecy 2. Action: Search the top 5 cards of the encounter deck for any 1 non-objective card worth no victory points and add it to your victory display. Shuffle the encounter deck. Add Out of the Wild to the victory display.

flavor:
'He is dead then,', said Frodo. 'I feared it was so.'
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: The End Comes
text: Response: After a Dwarf character leaves play, shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.

flavor:
"I am older than I look, I might prove useful."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Aragorn
text: Sentinel. Refresh Action: Reduce your threat to your starting threat level. (Limit once per game.)

flavor:
"We have not the time or the tools to bury our comrade fitly, or to raise a mound up over him. A cairn we might build."
<cite>Legolas, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Grave Cairn
text: Response: After a character leaves play, add its [attack] to another character's [attack] until the end of the round.

flavor:
"For the Sword that was Broken is the Sword of Elendil that broke beneath him when he fell."
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Sword that was Broken
text:
Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gains a [leadership] resource icon.
If attached hero is Aragorn, each character you control gets +1 [willpower].

name: Watcher of the Bruinen
text: Sentinel. Watcher of the Bruinen does not exhaust to defend. Forced: After Watcher of the Bruinen defends, either discard it from play or discard 1 card from your hand.

name: Rivendell Bow
text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan character, or to Aragorn. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gains ranged. If attached character has the printed ranged keyword, it gets +1 [attack] during a ranged attack.

flavor:
...in whom it was said that the likeness of Lúthien had come on earth again...for she was the Evenstar of her people.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Arwen Undómiel
text: Response: After Arwen Undómiel exhausts, choose a character. That character gains sentinel and gets +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

flavor:
"Believe rather that it is so ordered that we, who sit here, and none others, must now find counsel for the peril of the world."
<cite>Elrond, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Elrond's Counsel
text: Action: If you control a unique Noldor character, give another character +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase and lower your threat by 3.

flavor:
"I suppose we haven't lost more than two days by my short cut through the Forest!"
<cite>Frodo, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Short Cut
text: Response: After a location enters play, exhaust a Hobbit character to shuffle that location back into the encounter deck. Then, reveal 1 card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.

name: Legacy of Durin
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, draw 1 card.

name: Resourceful
text:
Secrecy 3.
Attach to a hero you control.
Attached hero collects 1 additional resource during the resource phase each round.

flavor: "Yet in doubt a man of worth will trust to his own wisdom." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Háma
text: Response: After Háma is declared as an attacker, return a [tactics] event from your discard pile to your hand. Then, choose and discard 1 card from your hand. (Limit 3 times per game for the group.)

flavor:
Beside Glorfindel there were several other counsellors of Elrond's household, of whom Erestor was the chief...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Erestor
text: Action: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand to draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.)

name: Fresh Tracks
text: Response: After an enemy is added to the staging area, deal 1 damage to that enemy. Players ignore that enemy while making engagement checks this round.

name: Erebor Battle Master
text: Erebor Battle Master gets +1 [attack] for each other Dwarf ally you control.

flavor:
"And all the arrows of all the hunters in the world would be in vain..."
<cite>Gimli, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Ring Mail
text: Attach to a Dwarf or Hobbit character. Restricted. Attached character gets +1 hit point and +1 [defense].

name: Out of Sight
text: Secrecy 3. Action: Enemies engaged with you cannot attack you this phase.

flavor:
'This is more to my liking,' said the dwarf, stomping on the stones. 'Ever my heart rises as we draw near the mountains.'
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Ever My Heart Rises
text: Attach a Dwarf character. Response: After you travel to a Mountain or Underground location, ready attached character and reduce your threat by 1.

flavor: "But for long years we healers have only sought to patch the rents made by the men of swords." <cite>Return of the King</cite>
name: Warden of Healing
text: Action: Exhaust Warden of Healing to heal 1 damage on up to 2 different characters. Then, you may pay 2 [lore] resources to ready Warden of Healing.

flavor: "Picking up a faggot he held it aloft for a moment, and then with a word of command, naur an edraith ammen! he thrust the end of his staff into the midst of it. At once a great spout of green and blue flame sprang out, and the wood flared and sputtered." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Word of Command
text: Action: Exhaust an Istari character to search your deck for 1 card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

flavor:
"I listened because I couldn't help myself, if you know what I mean. Lor bless me, sir, but I do love tales of that sort."
<cite>Sam Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Love of Tales
text: Attach to a [lore] hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: After a Song card is played, exhaust Love of Tales to add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool.

flavor:
Glorfindel was tall and straight; his hair was of shining gold, his face fair and young and fearless and full of joy; his eyes were bright and keen, and has voice like music; on his brow sat wisdom, and in his hand was strength.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Glorfindel
text: Forced: After Glorfindel exhausts to commit to a quest, raise your threat by 1.

name: Longbeard Elder
text: Response: After Longbeard Elder commits to a quest, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is a location, place 1 progress token on the current quest. Otherwise, Longbeard Elder gets -1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

flavor:
"However it may prove, one must tread the path that need chooses!"
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Path of Need
text:
Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a location.
Heroes do not exhaust to attack, defend, or commit to a quest while attached location is the active location.

name: Trollshaw Scout
text: Ranged. Trollshaw Scout does not exhaust to attack. Forced: After Trollshaw Scout attacks, either discard it from play or discard 1 card from your hand.

flavor: "Beside them Gimli stood with his stout legs apart, wielding his dwarf-axe." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Heavy Stroke
text: Response: After a Dwarf deals X damage to an enemy during combat, deal an additional X damage to that enemy. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Imladris Stargazer
text: Action: Exhaust Imladris Stargazer to choose a player. That player looks at the top 5 cards of his deck and then returns them to the top of his deck in any order.

flavor:
"... those who have dwelt in the blassed realm live at once in both worlds, and against both the Seen and Unseen they have great power."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Light of Valinor
text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan hero. Attached hero does not exhaust to commit to a quest.

flavor:
"These are Daeron's Runes, such as were used of old in Moria..."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Daeron's Runes
text: Action: Draw 2 cards. Then, discard 1 card from your hand.

name: Healing Herbs
text: Attach to a [lore] hero hero. Action: Discard Healing Herbs and exhaust attached hero to heal all damage on 1 character.

flavor: Suddenly into view below came a white horse, gleaming in the shadows, running swiftly. In the dusk its headstall flickered and flashed as if it were studded with gems like living stars. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Asfaloth
text: Attach to a Noldor or Silvan hero. Action: Exhaust Asfaloth to place 1 progress token on any location. (2 tokens instead if attached hero is Glorfindel.)

flavor:
"But you do not stand alone."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Elrond
text: You may spend resources from Elrond's resource pool to pay for [spirit], [leadership], and [tactics] allies. Response: After a character is healed by another card effect, heal 1 damage on it.

flavor: "You should see the stone-paved roads of many colours! And the halls and cavernous streets under the earth with arches carved like trees; and the terraces and towers upon the Mountain's sides! Then you would see that we have not been idle." <cite>Glóin, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: We Are Not Idle
text: Action: Exhaust X Dwarf heroes to add X resources to a hero's resource pool and draw 1 card.

flavor:
"We will seek the hidden door together. And we will come through. In the ruins of of the Dwarves, a dwarf's head will be less easy to bewilder than Elves or Men or Hobbits."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Hardy Leadership
text: Attach to a [leadership] hero. Each Dwarf gets +1 hit point.

flavor:
"We live now upon an island amid perils, and our hands are more often upon thr bowstring than upon the harp."
<cite>Haldir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Hands Upon the Bow
text: Action: Exhaust a character you control with ranged to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against an enemy in the staging area. It gets +1 [attack] during this attack.

name: O Elbereth! Gilthonial!
text: Secrecy 4. Response: After a non-unique enemy attacks you, put that enemy on the bottom of the encounter deck. If your threat is lower than that enemy's engagement cost, set your threat equal to the engagement cost of that enemy.

name: Miruvor
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Miruvor to (choose two): ready attached hero, add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool, attached hero gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round, or put Miruvor on the top of your deck.

name: Master of the Forge
text: Action: Exhaust Master of the Forge to search the top 5 cards of your deck for any 1 attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

flavor:
"Here you will hear many songs and tales-if you can keep awake. But except on high days it usually stands empty and quiet. and people come here who wish for peace, and thought. There is always a fire here, all the year round, but there is little other light."
<cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Peace, and Thought
text: Refresh Action: Exhaust 2 heroes to draw 5 cards.

name: Risk Some Light
text: Secrecy 3. Action: Look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. You may select 1 card and move it to the bottom of the encounter deck. Return any unselected cards to the top of the encounter deck, in any order.

flavor: ...mightiest of the Three. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Vilya
text: Attach to Elrond. He gains a [spirit] resource icon. Action: Exhaust Elrond and Vilya to reveal the top card of your deck. You can immediately play or put into play the revealed card for no cost, if able. Otherwise, move the revealed card to the bottom of your deck.

flavor: "It is over-late to send for aid when you are already besiged." <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Beregond
text: Sentinel. Lower the cost to play Weapon and Armor attachments on Beregond by 2.

flavor: "By our valour the wild fold of the East are still restrained, and the terror of Morgul kept at bay..." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Boromir
text: While Boromir has at least 1 resource in his resource pool, Gondor allies get +1 [attack].

flavor: For the people of the City used horses very little and they were seldom seen in their streets, save only those ridden by the errand-riders of their lord. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Errand-rider
text: Action: Exhaust Errand-rider to move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.

name: Citadel Custodian
text: Lower the cost to play Citadel Custodian by 1 for each Gondor ally in play.

flavor: "These are the Rohirrim, as we name them, masters of horses... and have ever proved true to us, aiding us at need, and guarding our northern marches and the Gap of Rohan." <cite>Faramir, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Mutual Accord
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, each Gondor card in play gains the Rohan trait, and each Rohan card in play gains the Gondor trait.

flavor: Kings made tombs more splendid than houses of the living, and counted old names in the rolls of their descent dearer than the names of sons. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Wealth of Gondor
text: Action: Choose a Gondor hero. Add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

flavor: "And the Enemy must pay dearly for the crossing of the River." <cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Defender of Rammas

flavor: ...seven walls of stone so strong and old that it seemed to have been not builded by carven by giants out of the bones of the earth. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Behind Strong Walls
text: Action: Ready a defending Gondor character. That character gets +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Spear of the Citadel
text: Restricted. Attach to a [tactics] character. Limit 1 per character. Response: After attached character is declared as a defender, deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

name: Damrod
text: Action: Discard Damrod from play to lower your threat by 1 for each enemy in the staging area.

flavor: "The beacons of Gondor are alight, calling for aid." <cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Light the Beacons
text: Action: All characters get +2 [defense] and do not exhaust to defend until the end of the round.

name: A Watchful Peace
text: Response: After a location worth no victory points leaves play as an explored location, return it to the top of the encounter deck.

flavor: "Believe not that in the land of Gondor the blood of Numenor is spent, nor all its pride and dignity forgotten." <cite>Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Blood of Númenor
text: Attach to a Gondor or Dúnedain hero. Action: Spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to give attached hero +1 [defense] for each resource in its resource pool until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor: From Lamedon, a few grim hillmen without a captain. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Hunter of Lamedon
text: Response: After you play Hunter of Lamedon from your hand, reveal the top card of your deck. If it is an Outlands card, add it to your hand. Otherwise, discard it.

flavor: Green gauntlets covered their hands, and their faces were hooded and masked with green, except for their eyes, which were very keen and bright. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Ithilien Tracker
text: Action: Exhaust Ithilien Tracker to lower the [threat] of the next enemy added to the staging area to 0 until the end of the phase.

flavor: "If Cirith Ungol is named, old men and masters of lore will blanch and fall silent." <cite>Faramir, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Master of Lore
text: Action: Exhaust Master of Lore to name a card type. Lower the cost for you to play the next [lore] card of that type by 1 until the end of the phase (to a minimum of 1).

name: Ranger Spikes
text:
Play Ranger Spikes into the staging area unattached.
If unattached, attach Ranger Spikes to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.
Players do not make engagement checks against attached enemy. Attached enemy gets -2 [threat].

name: Envoy of Pelargir
text: Response: After Envoy of Pelargir enters play, add 1 resource to a Gondor or Noble hero's resource pool.

flavor: Hirluin the Fair of the Green Hills from Pinnath Gelin... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Hirluin the Fair
text: Ranged. You may use resources from Hirluin the Fair's resource pool to pay for Outlands ally cards of any sphere.

flavor: ... grim-faced they were, and shorter and somewhat swarthier than any men that Pippin had yet seen in Gondor. <cite> The Return of the King</cite>
name: Warrior of Lossarnach
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [defense].

flavor: "Nay, my friends, I am the lawful master of the Stone, and I had both the right and the strength to use it..." <cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gaining Strength
text: Action: Discard 2 resources from your hero's resource pool to add 3 resources to that hero's resource pool.

flavor: ...foremost on the field rode the swan-knights of Dol Amroth with their Prince and his blue banner at their head. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Knights of the Swan
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [attack].

flavor:
There flowered a White Tree, and that was for Gondor...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gondorian Shield
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gains +1 [defense]. (+2 [defense] instead if attached hero has the Gondor trait.)

flavor:
We heard of the horns in the hills ringing,
the swords shining in the South-kingdom.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Ethir Swordsman
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [willpower].

name: Ring of Barahir
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +1 hit point for each Artifact attachment attached to it. If attached hero is Aragorn, he also gains a [lore] resource icon.

flavor: From the Anfalas, the Langstrand far away, a long line of men of many sorts, hunters and herdsmen and men of little villages... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Anfalas Herdsman
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 hit point.

flavor: "Let none now reject the counsels of Gandalf, whose long labours against Sauron come at last to their test." <cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Mithrandir's Advice
text: Action: Draw 1 card for each hero you control with a printed [lore] resource icon.

flavor: The townlands were rich, with wide tilth and many orchards, and homesteads there were with oast and garner, fold and byre, and many rills rippling through the green from the highlands down to the Anduin. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: A Good Harvest
text: Action: Name a sphere. Until the end of the phase, you can spend resources of any sphere when paying for cards that belong to the named sphere.

flavor:
"...the Elves feared and distrusted the world outside..."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Mirlonde
text: Each hero you control with a printed [lore] resource icon gets -1 threat cost.

flavor: "Forlong!" men shouted. "True heart, true friend!" <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Forlong
text: While you control Outlands allies that belong to 4 different spheres, ready Forlong at the beginning of each phase.

flavor: And so the companies came and were hailed and cheered and passed through the Gate, men of the Outlands marching to defend the City of Gondor in a dark hour... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Strength of Arms
text: Play only if each hero you control has a printed [leadership] resource icon. Action: Ready each ally in play.

flavor: He slew many of them and the rest fled. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Mighty Prowess
text: Attach to a [tactics] hero hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, deal 1 damage to another enemy that shares a Trait with the enemy just destroyed.

name: Trained for War
text: Play only if each hero you control has the printed [tactics] resource icon. Action: Until the end of the phase, if the current quest does not have Siege, it gains Battle.

flavor:
"The Elves have their own labours and their own sorrows..."
<cite>Gildor, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Silvan Refugee
text: Forced: After a character leaves play, discard Silvan Refugee from play.

flavor: "Courage will now be your best defense against the storm that is at hand..." <cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Against the Shadow
text: Play only if each hero you control has the printed [spirit] resource icon. Action: Until the end of the phase, [spirit] characters use their [willpower] instead of [defense].

flavor: For the Elves of the High Kindred had not yet forsaken Middle-earth, and they dwelt still at that time at the Grey Havens...<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Harbor Master
text: Response: After a card effect adds any number of resources to the resource pool of a hero you control, Harbor Master gains +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

flavor: Suddenly he halted and listened. Had he heard a whistle or not? Or was it the call of some strange bird? <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Advance Warning
text: Play only if each hero you control has a printed [lore] resource icon. Action: Until the end of the phase, enemies do not make engagement checks.

flavor: The watchmen cried aloud, and all men in the City stood to arms. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: White Tower Watchman
text: If each hero you control belongs to the same sphere of influence, you may assign damage from undefended enemy attacks to White Tower Watchman instead of a hero you control.

flavor: "There must be someone with intelligence in the party." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Pippin
text: If each hero you control has the Hobbit trait, Pippin gains: "Response: After an enemy engages you, raise your threat by 3 to return it to the staging area. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot engage you."

flavor: "Denethor is of another sort, proud and subtile, a man of far greater lineage and power, though he is not called a king." <cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Denethor
text:
Denethor gets -1 [willpower] for each damaged hero you control.
Discard Denethor if his [willpower] is 0 or less.

flavor: "The Captains of the Outlands are expected up the South Road ere sundown. Come with us and you will see." <cite>Bergil, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Lord of Morthond
text: Attach to a Gondor or Outlands hero. If each hero you control has a printed [leadership] resource icon, Lord of Morthond gains: "Response: After you play a [lore], [spirit], or [tactics] ally, draw 1 card."

name: Book of Eldacar
text: Attach to a [tactics] hero. Reduce the cost to play Book of Eldacar by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [tactics] resource icon. Action: Discard Book of Eldacar to play any [tactics] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

flavor: At last, less than a mile from the City, a more ordered mass of men came into view, marching not running, still holding together. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gondorian Discipline
text: Response: Cancel up to 2 points of damage just dealt to a Gondor character.

name: Minas Tirith Lampwright
text: Response: After an encounter card with surge is revealed, discard Minas Tirith Lampwright to name enemy, location, or treachery. If the next encounter card revealed is the named type, discard it without resolving its effects.

name: Small Target
text: Response: After a Hobbit hero you control exhausts to defend an attack, choose another enemy engaged with you and reveal the attacking enemy's shadow card. If that shadow card has no shadow effect, resolve this enemy's attack against the chosen enemy. If that shadow card has a shadow effect, resolve this attack as normal.

name: Ithilien Archer
text: Ranged. Response: After Ithilien Archer attacks and damages an enemy, return that enemy to the staging area.

name: Ithilien Pit
text:
Play Ithilien Pit into the staging area unattached.
If unattached, attach Ithilien Pit to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.
Any character may choose attached enemy as the target of an attack.

flavor:
They possessed from the first the art of disappearing swiftly and silently, when large folk whom they do not wish to meet come blundering by...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Hobbit-sense
text: Play only if each of your heroes is a Hobbit. Combat Action: Enemies engaged with you do not attack this round. You cannot declare attacks this round.

flavor: "The road may pass, but they shall not! Not while Faramir is Captain." <cite>Mablung, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Faramir
text:
Ranged.
Faramir gets +1 [attack] for each enemy in the staging area.

flavor:
The Morthond Valye made a great bay that beat up against the sheer southern faces of the mountains.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Sword of Morthond
text: Attach to a Gondor ally. Attached ally gains the Outlands trait.

flavor:
Death in the morning and at day's ending
lords took and lowly. Long now they sleep
under grass in Gondor by the Great River.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Men of the West
text: Action: Return X Outlands allies from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Knight of Minas Tirith
text: If each of your heroes has a printed [tactics] hero resource icon, Knight of Minas Tirith Tirith gains: "Response: After Knight of Minas Tirith enters play, choose an enemy in the staging area. Engage that enemy and exhaust Knight of Minas Tirith to declare it as attacker (and resolve its attack) against that enemy."

name: Gondorian Fire
text: Attach to a Gondor or Dúnedain hero. Action: Spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to give attached hero +1 [attack] for each resource in its resource pool until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor:
"It is forty leagues and two from Pelargir to the landings at the Harlond..."
<cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Pelargir Shipwright
text: Pelargir Shipwright gets +1 [willpower] for each hero you control with a printed [spirit] hero resource icon.

name: Map of Earnil
text: Attach to a [spirit] hero. Reduce the cost to play Map of Earnil by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [spirit] resource icon. Action: Discard Map of Earnil to play any [spirit] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

flavor:
Two had great bows, almost of their own height, and great quivers of long green-feathered arrows.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Ranger Bow
text: Restricted. Attach to a Ranger character. Action: Exhaust Ranger Bow and attached character to deal 1 damage to an enemy in the staging area.

flavor: "For coming unbidden to this play death is our law." <cite>Anborn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Forest Patrol
text: Play only if you control at least 1 Ranger character. Action: Deal 3 damage to an enemy with at least 1 Trap card attached to it.

name: Palantir
text: Attach to a Noble hero. Planning Action: Exhaust Palantir and attached hero to name a card type and look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. For each of those cards that matches the named type, draw a card. For each of those cards that does not match the named type, raise your threat by 2.

flavor:
...there is no purpose higher in the world as it now stands than the good of Gondor...
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Caldara
text: Action: Discard Caldara to put 1 [spirit] ally from your discard pile into play for each other hero you control with a printed [spirit] resource icon. (Limit once per game.)

flavor:
As he spoke he struck a small silver gong that stood near his footstool, and at once servants came forward.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Squire of the Citadel
text: Response: After Squire of the Citadel leaves play, add 1 resource to a Gondor hero's resource pool.

name: Tome of Atanatar
text: Attach to a [leadership] hero. Reduce the cost to play Tome of Atanatar by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [leadership] resource icon. Action: Discard Tome of Atanatar to play any [leadership] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

name: Guthlaf
text: If there is at least 1 Rohan hero in play, lower the cost to play Guthlaf by 1. If there is at least 1 Gondor hero in play, Guthlaf gains sentinel.

flavor:
..we have this honour: ever we bear the brunt of the chief hatred of the Dark Lord, for that hatred comes down out of the of the depths of time and over the deeps of the Sea.
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: The Hammer-stroke
text: Encounter Action: Engage each enemy in play.

name: Emery
text: Action: Discard the top 3 card of your deck to put Emery into play from your hand, under any player's control. Then, if any of the discarded cards have the [tactics], [lore] or [leadership] sphere, discard Emery.

flavor:
"For deep in the hears of all my kindred lies the sea-longing, which it is perilous to stir"
<cite>Legolas, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Children of the Sea
text: Action: Choose a Silvan or Noldor ally you control. That ally gets +2 [willpower] until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, shuffle that ally into its owner's deck if it is still in play.

flavor:
"I sent my keenest huntsmen to seek him, but he slipped them, and they had no sight of him till now, save Anborn."
<cite>Faramir, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Anborn
text: Action: Exhaust Anborn to return 1 Trap card from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Poisoned Stakes
text:
Play Poisoned Stakes into the staging area unattached.
If unattached, attach Poisoned Stakes to the next eligble enemy that enters the staging area.
At the end of each round, deal 2 damage to attached enemy.

flavor:
Gimli the Dwarf alone wore openly a short shirt of steel-rings, for dwarves make light of burdens...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Well-Equipped
text: Action: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. You may attach 1 attachment card discarded by this effect to an eligible Dwarf character in play.

flavor: 'To me! To me!' cried Théoden. 'Up Eorlingas! Fear no darkness!' <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Théoden
text:
Sentinel.
Each [tactics] hero with a printed [tactics] resource icon gets +1 [willpower].

name: Pelargir Ship Captain
text: Response: After Pelargir Ship Captain enters play, move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.

flavor: "...still the lords of Gondor have keener sight than lesser men..." <cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Visionary Leadership
text: Attach to a Gondor hero. While attached hero has at least 1 resource in its resource pool, Gondor characters get +1 [willpower].

flavor: Right through the press drove Théoden Thengel's son, and his spear was shivered as he threw down thier chieftan. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Spear of the Mark
text: Restricted. Attach to a Rohan character. Attached character gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attacking an enemy in the staging area).

flavor: "Oaths ye have taken: now fulfill them all, to lord and land and league of friendship!" <cite>Théoden, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Forth Eorlingas!
text: Combat Action: Each Rohan hero can be declared as an attacker against enemies in the staging area this phase.

flavor: ...fresh horses were always in readiness to bear his errand-riders to Rohan in the Noth... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Steed of the Mark
text: Attach to a Gondor or Rohan hero. Response: after attached hero commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to ready attached hero.

flavor:
An Elven-maid there was of old.
A shining star by day:
Her mantle white was hemmed with hold,
Her shoes of silver-grey.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lay of Nimrodel
text: Action: Choose a [spirit] hero. Until the end of the phase, that hero gets +1 [willpower] for each resource in its resource pool.

name: Ered Nimrais Prospector
text: Response: After Ered Nimrais Prospector enters play, discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Then, choose and shuffle 1 card from your discard pile back into your deck.

name: Scroll of Isildur
text: Attach to a [lore] hero. Reduce the cost to play Scroll of Isildur by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [lore] resource icon. Action: Discard Scroll of Isildur to play any [lore] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

flavor:
...there was a good deal of food jumbled carlessly on shelves and on the ground, among an untidy litter of plunder...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Hidden Cache
text: Response: After Hidden Cache is discarded from your deck, add 2 resources to the resource pool of a hero you control. Action: Spend 1 resource to draw 1 card.

flavor: "I am named Éomer son of Éomund, and am called the Third Marshal of Riddermark." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Éomer
text: Response: After a character leaves play, Éomer gets +2 [attack] until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: "Let your counsellor Gríma keep all things till your return – and I pray that we may see it, though no wise man will deem it hopeful." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Gríma
text: Action: Lower the cost of the next card you play from your hand this round by 1. That card gains Doomed 1. (Limit once per round.)

name: Saruman
text: Doomed 3. At the end of the round, discard Saruman from play. Response: After Saruman enters play, choose a non-unique enemy or location in the staging area. While Saruman is in play, the chosen enemy or location is considered to be out of play.

flavor: "...the keepers of the gate were on the watch for me and told me that Saruman awaited me." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Orthanc Guard
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, ready Orthanc Guard.

flavor: "I have an urgent errand," he said. "My news is evil." <cite>Radagast, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Isengard Messenger
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, Isengard Messenger gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round. (Limit twice per round.)

flavor: "Erkenbrand of Westfold has drawn off those men he could gather towards his fastness at Helm's Deep. The rest are scattered." <cite>Rider of Rohan, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Westfold Outrider
text: Action: Discard Westfold Outrider to choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage the chosen enemy.

flavor: "They love their horses next to their kin." <cite>Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Westfold Horse-breeder
text: Response: After Westfold Horse-breeder enters play, search the top 10 cards of your deck for a Mount attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

flavor: Their horses were of great stature, strong and clean-limbed... <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Rohan Warhorse
text: Attach to a [tactics] or Rohan hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Rohan Warhorse to ready attached hero.

flavor: ...one of them uncovered a small lamp that gave out a slender silver beam. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Silver Lamp
text:
Attach to a [spirit] hero.
While attached hero is ready, shadow cards dealt to enemies engaged with you are dealt face up. (Shadow card effects are still resolved when resolving enemy attacks.)

flavor: "He has the Key of Orthanc" <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Keys of Orthanc
